message.content:
To extract a three character code like "1Jn" from a filename in format "57-1Jn.usfm", you can use the following regular expression:

```
^([0-9]*)-(.{3}).*?\.usfm$
```

In this regex, `^` represents the start of the string, `[0-9]*` matches any number of digits (optional), `-` matches the hyphen, `.{3}` matches exactly three characters which could be upper or lower case letters or digits, and `.*?\.usfm$` makes sure that there's a ".usfm" extension at the end of the string.

You can use this regex to extract the three character code from the filename using tools like Python's re module or JavaScript's RegExp object.
